alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 21 at 4:09PM AKST until December 23 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON FRIDAY TO 3 PM AKST SATURDAY FOR THE BRISTOL BAY COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Visibility of one quarter mile or less at times. North wind gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay coast, including Port Heiden and from Dillingham west to Goodnews Bay. * WHEN...From noon Friday to 3 PM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Port Heiden will see the longest duration of blizzard conditions. Dillingham, which will be near the eastern edge of the snow band, may see a shorter duration of blizzard conditions if the snow band moves westward more quickly. Easterly gusts as high as 45 mph are possible around Iliamna Lake on Friday night, but no snow or blowing snow is expected for this area.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
